abit/a-proposal-to-change-the-early-voti.author: abit
abit/a-proposal-to-change-the-early-voti.body:
The new curation reward algorithm proposed by Steemit in [this post](https://steemit.com/steem/@steemitblog/latest-curation-reward-solution) is highly bias to authors, and greatly negatively impacts voting experience, as I've described in [this post](https://steemit.com/steem/@abit/new-curation-reward-algorithm-huge-penalty-to-early-voters) earlier. With this proposal, minnows have no chance to earn anything by voting, their either vote early so most benefit will go to authors, or vote late so their voting weight will be highly diluted by earlier voters especially whales. In the meanwhile bots can still adjust their strategy to make a reasonable return.

Here is my proposal:
* set a time window, for example 5 minutes after an author post a new article, in this window, everyone have same time-weight, so bots have few advantage, and normal voters have chance to read the article and vote accordingly
* within the time window, let Steem Power be weighted by a curve flatter than linear, for example `log(n)` or `n^0.5` , so minnows will get bigger benefit
* after the time window, linear or super linear time-weight kicks in, and linear or super linear Steem Power weight kicks in, so whales and bots compete on boosting the content reward for better curation reward, in the meanwhile give early voters more benefit
* 50% to voters, 50% to authors. No cut to discussions (which imo will lead to spamming and self voting).

Thoughts?

//Update:
I noticed that there is a new 'vote' check-box while creating a new article. IMO this give authors unfair advantage to leech curation rewards, which is against the principle/consensus of sharing. An author would already know her post is expected to be valuable or not, thus this early vote brings few value to the system. If the author is a minnow, it's acceptable to gain a little more reward. But I won't vote on any article with a meaningful weighted instant vote from the author. Above proposal addresses this issue ideally.
abit/a-proposal-to-change-the-early-voti.root_title: A Proposal to Change the Early Voting Penalty and Benefit Minnow Voters
abit/a-proposal-to-change-the-early-voti.title: A Proposal to Change the Early Voting Penalty and Benefit Minnow Voters

abit/abit-witness-log-2016-9-2.author: abit
abit/abit-witness-log-2016-9-2.body:
This week, I just came back from vacation and got a lot of personal affairs to deal with, so left no much time working on Steem. Nevertheless, I spent some time discussing new features of next hard fork and reviewing the core code, and found a few bugs, see github issue/pull-request #239, #278, #329, #343 and etc. 

I'll have more time next week.

In regards to Chinese community, recently we got a few developers and a few authors, however total activities seem to be declining. It's probably caused by the declining token price, author reward centralization issue, and lack of incentives to bring new users.
abit/abit-witness-log-2016-9-2.title: Abit Witness Log ~ 2016-9-2

abit/abit-witness-log-2016-9-3-2016-9-9.author: abit
abit/abit-witness-log-2016-9-3-2016-9-9.body:
No much to update in this week.

Done some code review for coming hard fork 14,  issues found in last week have been fixed, and found no new bug, although some feature design is expected to be improved.

Migrated nodes to servers with more RAM. Upgraded nodes to new release, ready for the hard fork.

//Update:
A forking bug is found in 0.14 code just now, related to [issue #259](https://github.com/steemit/steem/issues/259). Witnesses should stick with or revert to 0.13 until a fix is released.
abit/abit-witness-log-2016-9-3-2016-9-9.title: Abit Witness Log 2016-9-3 ~ 2016-9-9

abit/for-smoother-consensus-change-or-no.author: abit
abit/for-smoother-consensus-change-or-no.body:
Update (29/06/2016): 
* Another crashing issue with 0.5.0 has been addressed yesterday. For the ones who want to stick with 0.5.0 consensus, please install v0.5.2 provided by @arhag: https://github.com/arhag/steem/commits/v0_5_2
* Steemit released v0.8.1 yesterday

----original post (26/06/2016)---------
Steem 0.8.0 has been released for a while. According to the [announcement](https://steemit.com/steem/@steemitblog/steem-0-8-0-released), the new release fixed an issue which will crash the earlier 0.5.0 release on July 4th (quoted below).

> Fix Divide by Zero Error
The existing code has a bug that will cause a divide by zero error on July 4th for anyone who does not upgrade to new code. This means that not upgrading by July 4th is not an option.

This makes 0.8.0 look like a forced upgrade, although "if the majority of the witnesses upgrade" is mentioned in earlier that announcement. In my opinion, it is not the best practice. In case when a serious bug is found in 0.8.0  before the scheduled hard fork time and if have no sufficient time to make a fix (I'm not saying it will 100% happen but it's possible), the whole block chain network will have to be stopped for some time, at that time it's best if witnesses can still run on 0.5.0 consensus until a fix is released. 

Fortunately, there are other solutions for witnesses to be able to stay on the 0.5.0 consensus without upgrading to 0.8.0 or crashing the program. One solution is made by @arhag ([link is here](https://github.com/steemit/steem/pull/91)). In addition, there is a bug in 0.5.0 which prevents a witness_node from downgrading from a higher version to 0.5.0, so need to apply the [2nd patch](https://github.com/steemit/steem/commit/56461684c9adf9e61c1d2ba539c903d8acf0d58c). Full steps:
```
git clone https://github.com/steemit/steem.git
cd steem
git checkout v0.5.0
git fetch origin pull/91/head:v0_5_0-fix-77
git cherry-pick 3ab1a040dd0a43226e73a55db5934cb985e4cf5d #divid-by-0 fix
git cherry-pick 56461684c9adf9e61c1d2ba539c903d8acf0d58c #version downgrading fix
git submodule update --init --recursive
cmake -DENABLE_CONTENT_PATCHING=OFF -DLOW_MEMORY_NODE=ON .
make steemd cli_wallet
```

Disclaimer: I'm not saying I'm supporting or I'm against the upgrade to consensus 0.8.0 right now. Just wanted to provide a way for better consensus decision-making.
abit/for-smoother-consensus-change-or-no.root_title: For smoother consensus change or no change: a fix for Steem 0_5_0 to avoid crashing on July 4th
abit/for-smoother-consensus-change-or-no.title: For smoother consensus change or no change: a fix for Steem 0_5_0 to avoid crashing on July 4th

abit/more-info-about-how-supercomputing-.author: abit
abit/more-info-about-how-supercomputing-.body:
@arhag wrote a [post](https://steemit.com/steem/@arhag/how-supercomputing-was-able-to-dominate-the-mining-queue-and-how-the-bug-was-fixed) described how @supercomputing was able to dominate the mining queue before hard fork 13.

Here is the old algorithm described in @arhag's post:
```
1) hash1     = SHA256(latest_block_id)

2) hash2     = hash1 except for the first 64-bits replaced by some nonce (basically some random number selected to try to make the final work value have a sufficient number of leading 0 bits)

3) input     = SHA256(hash2)

4) sig       = ECDSA signature (in 65-byte format) of input using d (the active private key) and k (which is just another nonce used for signing)

5) sig_hash  = SHA256(sig)

6) pubkey    = Recover public key (33-byte format) corresponding to the private key that would have signed sig_hash with signature sig

7) work      = SHA256(pubkey)

work must have sufficient number of leading 0 bits matching the current mining difficulty target
```

In the post @arhag described:
> ... quickly (within a millisecond) calculate the corresponding private key necessary to make the new PoW valid according to the mining algorithm ... With the appropriate active private key `d` computed, the attacker can then change their account's active public key to the one corresponding to the private key ...

But there is a hole in the description, because the private key of a given signature shouldn't be so quickly to be resolved -- it's the nature of ECC algo.

**Actually, with the old algorithm, to submit a PoW, an attacker doesn't need to know the private key.**

When an attacker got an `input` with latest `head_block_id` and whatever `nounce` in step 3), and if she already have a known will-work `sig` in step 4), she can simply **recover** the public key (which is needed to put into the PoW operation) with the same method used in step 6). In addition, because a transaction contains only a PoW operation requires no signature (which is another hole in the old algo which got fixed in new algo),  the PoW will be accepted by other nodes.
abit/more-info-about-how-supercomputing-.root_title: More Info About How @supercomputing Was Dominating The Mining Queue
abit/more-info-about-how-supercomputing-.title: More Info About How @supercomputing Was Dominating The Mining Queue

abit/my-steem-witness-voting-changes.author: abit
abit/my-steem-witness-voting-changes.body:
To whom it may concern, I'm now changing my votes for witnesses.

I will vote for who
* cares about security and stability of the platform

I won't vote for who
* doesn't take care of price feeds, or
* run unverified version for block producing. Current appropriate releases are: 0.5.0 released by @steemit, 0.8.0 released by @steemit, 0.5.1 released by @arhag.

By the way, there is a bug in 0.8.0, which can cause unintended forking before scheduled hard fork time (which is bad). I personally suggest that anyone who wants to upgrade should stick with or downgrade to 0.5.0 and wait for a new release.
abit/my-steem-witness-voting-changes.title: My Steem witness voting changes

abit/new-curation-reward-algorithm-huge-.author: abit
abit/new-curation-reward-algorithm-huge-.body:
//Update:
The code has changed, from `^2` to linear, so less penalty now, but still some. Link is [here](https://github.com/steemit/steem/commit/6300a795cae5e78f68b52d03ea0918bf8354e600)

// Update 2:
The penalty on voters goes to the author. So, potential (evil?) effective voting strategies:
* authors vote for self to earn more liquid SD, and dilutes later voters weight
* bots vote for the authors who agree to compensate (since authors will get more liquid SD, so even easier to compensate)
* greedy voters be more selectively

-----------Original post----------------------
According to the [code](https://github.com/steemit/steem/blob/dd86ddecf99ec238bc7e3a3a40c53e12f017d782/libraries/chain/steem_evaluator.cpp#L712-L721), the new algo brings a huge penalty to early voters. The formula is 
```
curation_reward_weight = standard_weight * [(now - post_create_time) / 30_minutes]^2
```
where `standard_weight` is related to one's steem power,  voting power, and total weight of earlier voters.

It means
* if vote 30 minutes after a post is created, the weight for reward is `(30/30)^2 = 100% * standard_weight`
* if vote 20 minutes after a post is created, the weight for reward is `(20/30)^2 = 44% * standard_weight`
* if vote 10 minutes after a post is created, the weight for reward is `(10/30)^2 = 11% * standard_weight`
* if vote 5 minutes after a post is created, the weight for reward is `(5/30)^2 = 2.8% * standard_weight`
* if vote 3 minutes after a post is  created, the weight for reward is `(3/30)^2 = 1% * standard_weight`

Reference: [latest proposal](https://steemit.com/steem/@steemitblog/latest-curation-reward-solution):
>Our solution is to offer a reverse auction for curation rewards on votes cast within the first 30 minutes. The price starts out at 100% of your curation reward and falls toward 0% over 30 minutes using the curve (1-t2). The longer a bot waits to vote, the lower the fee will be. However, if someone else chooses to vote before you it would lower your potential absolute reward.

abit/steem-v0-12-0.author: abit
abit/steem-v0-12-0.body:
这个修改昨天（2016-7-26）已经生效。请注意。
英文原贴： https://steemit.com/steem/@steemitblog/steem-version-0-12-0-released

### 1. 发帖频率限制
为了防止恶意刷帖，每个账号每24小时的前4个主贴，会100%统计得票情况，发奖。从第5个主贴开始，奖励大量减少。

### 2. 发奖时间调整
第一次发奖时间仍然是根据顶贴人的Steem Power来加权计算确定。修改内容：
* 老算法第一次发奖是24小时后，新算法是12小时后
* 老算法第一次发奖后，后续奖励仍然按照新的顶贴权重来计算，大约每24小时发一次；新算法是第二次发奖推迟到30天后
* 30天后不再发奖（老算法是多少天忘记了，有时间再补充）

### 3. 锁帖机制
第一次发奖后帖子不再可以编辑。（以后会开发替代直接编辑的功能，敬请期待）

### 4. 回帖限制
第二次发奖后不可再回帖。（可能也会有替代功能）

其他修改略过不提。
abit/steem-v0-12-0.title: Steem v0.12.0 修改内容

abit/steemd-resync-and-replay-speed-boos.author: abit
abit/steemd-resync-and-replay-speed-boos.body:
Try this command while compiling steemd:
```
cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DENABLE_CONTENT_PATCHING=OFF -DLOW_MEMORY_NODE=ON .
```

Then you'll get something like:
```
Done reindexing, elapsed time: 129.203519 sec`
```

Explanation:
steemd is built in `Debug` mode by default, as a result replay/resync takes ages. The speed will improve a lot if  build in `Release` mode.

abit/to-authors-with-large-steem-power-p.author: abit
abit/to-authors-with-large-steem-power-p.body:
You know you have a unfair advantage as an author, as you can upvote for yourself instantly when posting a new article. We know that you want eye balls and followers, that's fine.

But that looks greedy. As a popular author, you've already got a lot of people following you. After you voted with a large Steem Power, the reward for people voting after you will be diluted much. For better curation reward distribution, to give your followers' more reward, I sincerely suggest that you don't vote for yourself when posting.

This suggestion applies especially to early adopters for example @dan, @dantheman, @theoretical and @blocktrades, but also applies to new authors who gained meaningful Steem Power via writing, for example @stellabelle, @cryptoctopus, @donkeypong and etc.

Thanks.

//Edit:
For authors with not much Steem Power, I think it's not too bad to vote instantly.

abit/ubuntu-steem.author: abit
abit/ubuntu-steem.body:
在一个干净的 Ubuntu 14 LTS 64bit  环境里，按照下面的步骤编译，应该不会有问题。如果环境不干净，请自己找原因。

注1：从sourceforge下载 boost 很慢，我不知道国内怎么下载 boost 比较方便，知道的请补充。
注2：gcc 4.9安装了好像没有用到，有时间的可以确认下

```
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install gcc-4.9 cmake make libbz2-dev libdb++-dev libdb-dev libssl-dev openssl libreadline-dev autoconf libtool git autotools-dev build-essential g++ libbz2-dev libicu-dev python-dev doxygen ntp

wget -c 'http://sourceforge.net/projects/boost/files/boost/1.57.0/boost_1_57_0.tar.bz2/download' -O boost_1_57_0.tar.bz2
tar xjf boost_1_57_0.tar.bz2
cd boost_1_57_0
./bootstrap.sh
sudo ./b2 install
cd ..

git clone https://github.com/steemit/steem.git
cd steem
git checkout v0.12.2
git submodule update --init --recursive

mkdir build
cd build
cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DENABLE_CONTENT_PATCHING=OFF -DLOW_MEMORY_NODE=ON ..
make steemd cli_wallet
```

编译好之后怎么使用，有时间再发帖。
